Description: Upper part of a mould-made oval pottery lamp, decorated on the top with two naked men or satyrs holding a basket of grapes, with grapes and vines behind them. Between them is an uncertain object, possibly incorporating a bull's head; this is partially obscured by an applied conical handle. The shoulder is decorated with short rays.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2202.bis)
